body: Oh, it's a huge my mistake. I will add 0.26 and 0.27.

@yunseong . 
I think we had better keep all of them for a while in order to show the _power of REEF_ as a good abstraction layer. We can delete old versions if REEF is unable to support them for some dependency issue? Moreover, the maintenance cost of docker code is tiny, isn't it?

The tests passed on Mesos 0.26, but unfortunately, failed on Mesos0.27. More tests than the ones we experienced in other PR, cause timeout. The environment I used is Ubuntu 14.04 with 4 cores (w/ hyperthread) and 32GB. 
Could you double-check it still passes on your end?
Oh, I will check that again. Thanks, @yunseong .

Right, for Mesos0.27, only `TEST_DriverTest` passes. I found that it's not a REEF or docker's problem. It's due to a critical bug [MESOS-4585](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MESOS-4585), and will be release as 0.27.1 soon. I think we should remove Mesos0.27 for now to complete REEF 0.14 release.

@yunseong , according to your advice, I changed `README.md` like the following.

```
+| MESOS | Ubuntu 12.04 | Apache Mesos 0.24~0.26  |      | mesos0.24 ~ 0.26 |
```

You can see it on my github branch, too. Is it okay?
https://github.com/dongjoon-hyun/reef/blob/REEF-1181/dev/docker/README.md

Thank you for all your efforts as a release manager! :)
@markusweimer @anupam128 @jwang98052 : You've expressed interest in the previous version of this PR; do you want to review the new one?
I'll take a pass.

@markusweimer, @afchung 

Can one of you take a look on this one please?

Does xunit generate an output file?
If it does, we could have [incremental tests](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms171483.aspx) using something like:

``` xml
<Target Name="Test" Inputs="$(OutputPath)\$(AssemblyName).dll" Outputs="XUnitOutputForThisTestAssembly">
```

This would rerun the test only if the DLL is rebuilt.
I got carried away. We don't need to do this right now.
Only debug builds run tests in this scenario?
I'll take a look at this.

I'll note the incremental tests wish, maybe we can look into that later.

Right, we need to be able to test release builds also. Let me check how to pass configuration and platform as command line parameters from msbuild call.
@anupam128 This looks good to me overall, just a few comments. Have you tested this for both types of YARN submission (legacy + rest)? Thanks!
@shulmanb Done with a first pass. Looks good overall. Thanks!

https://reefdev.azurehdinsight.net/yarnui/hn/cluster/app/application_1454221066765_0021 (credentials needed) shows a successful run for HDInsight.
REST result:
application_1455239441114_0012 gopher HelloREEF REEF default Mon Feb 22 11:50:49 -0800 2016 Mon Feb 22 11:51:06 -0800 2016 FINISHED SUCCEEDED N/A 
 History N/A
Legacy result: 
application_1455239441114_0011 anupam HelloREEF YARN default Mon Feb 22 11:50:18 -0800 2016 Mon Feb 22 11:50:41 -0800 2016 FINISHED SUCCEEDED N/A 
 History N/A
@afchung Done with comments please take a look.
@afchung made the changes.
Looks good to me, I'll test and merge.
@afchung Done with fixing comments, please take a look.
@anupam128 Just noticed that there are test stubs in the code. Perhaps we should remove them or extend the example?
I completed a pass.
Test pass. I'll merge it. Thanks for waiting long :)

I'm the one who made so many mistakes in this PR. :-)
Oh, thank YOU, @yunseong .
I'll take a look.
Could anyone take a look if you have time? Thanks!
Ah, thanks @dafrista!!

+1 on Java side. It looks like maven installs the correct 0.15.0-SNAPSHOT packages.
Can someone check on the windows side that packages build smoothly as 0.15.0-SNAPSHOT? Possibly @markusweimer ? :)
Will test to build this on Windows, both java and .NET

The java side seems to be fine, but the .NET side has a failure in `TestDeserializationForContextAndTask`:

```
System.IO.FileLoadExceptionCould not load file or assembly 'Org.Apache.REEF.Driver, Version=0.14.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=c27bf5b2e9a7ddb9' or one of its dependencies. The located assembly's manifest definition does not match the assembly reference. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131040)
```

@jwang98052, this is the test that relies on a magic artifact in the repository, right? Can you explain how to recreate it such that we can add that to the version upgrade script. Or, better yet, delete the test and replace it with one without this problem.
This needs some more description on the JIRA. I left a note there.
@shulmanb Is this "done" I see that there have been commits since you posted it and asked for review?
I've done a pass.
@shulmanb Is it possible to split this into more manageable chunks? This PR seems to cover a lot of items.
@afchung I prefer not to split it as it is hard to split it to parts that compile separatly
@markusweimer  this is done. Fixed some build errors after the initial commit
@afchung Most of the logic is in one class RuntimesHost and the event handlers just delegate calls to it. Also I prefer having tests and code in the same checkin
@shulmanb I've done a coding style-level review.
Hi, @jwang98052 . I'll test and merge this.

Hi, @afchung . LGTM.
I'll test and merge this.
I think we can edit that file with python Avro library. But, we need `PublicKeyToken` as a new argument for that script. Any idea?
@markusweimer done working on PR comments.

Hi, All.
I created a JIRA issue [REEF-1220](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1220) and PR #857 to update `change_version.py` to handle Avro-binary format resource files: `evaluator.conf` and `evaluatorWithService.conf`.
After applying #857 and executing `C:\Python27\python.exe .\dev\change_version.py -s true C:\Users\dongjoon\reef 0.15.0`, all tests in `Test Explorer` are passed.

Hopefully, I think this PR #857 can help @yunseong finish the release.
@dongjoon-hyun Thanks a lot for the help! I hope your work can fix the problem, but I'm not available right now. Could someone test & review #857? I'll do it if has not been done tonight.
@jwang98052 Looks good to me, just one small nit.
@afchung Thanks for the review. I have addressed review comments and pushed in the change.

looks good to me.

@jwang98052 can we merge?

I've done another pass.

I have to think some more about the passing of hash maps in `public` interfaces. This is the second time we introduce a somewhat dirty `public` API as part of this new feature, which to me indicates that we are doing something not quite right here.
Looks good to me, will merge.
Looks good to me.
I'll test and merge.
When I run tests locally (from Visual Studio test explorer) with this change, O.A.R.Evaluator.Tests crush. master branch is fine

I've tried to test #857 on my end, but I installed 32bit Win10 where I'm not allowed to run tests for x64 architecture. I'll retry with 64-bit Windows, but it'd be appreciated if someone run test if you have time.

If this change is tested with last commit before it being
`c2cca49 [REEF-1218]  Revert FileStatus constructor as public`
Evaluator.Tests crush. However, if I rebase the branch to current master, so that last commit is 
`b45c29c [REEF-1209] Implement SuspendTask on the Evaluator`
tests pass. So I guess this change is fine, it was some earlier issue that got fixed.

This PR addresses the build failure but I'm not 100% sure that this approach fixes the problem entirely; we need to refactor the example code to avoid using the hard-coded version, then we don't have to update those files in this script.

We can tackle the refactoring in a separate PR, though at least it'd be good to have `TODO` to track this issue in the future. @markusweimer Any thought?

+1 to remove `hard-coded version`. I really agree with you!
In fact, I don't like `change_verson.py`.

It builds and tests in VS passed. However, I keep getting the following error when run msbuild TestRunner.proj. 

  === TEST EXECUTION SUMMARY ===
     Org.Apache.REEF.Tests  Total: 36, Errors: 0, Failed: 4, Skipped: 7, Time: 247.081s
C:\reef\ReefApache\reef2\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.csproj(184,5): error MSB3073: The command "..\packages\xunit.runner.console.2.1.0\tools\xunit.console.
exe ..\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.dll" exited with code 4.
Done Building Project "C:\reef\ReefApache\reef2\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.csproj" (Test target(s)) -- FAILED.

Done Building Project "C:\reef\ReefApache\reef2\lang\cs\TestRunner.proj" (default targets) -- FAILED.

Build FAILED.

I believe this is a test we wanted to delete in an earlier PR. The reason to remove the test brought forward by @afchung was to address exactly this issue: The file is a "magic" file in the tests that should really be generated correctly as part of the test instead of materialization in the repository. @jwang98052 wanted to keep it.

Can I ask @afchung and @jwang98052 to comment on the issue? I currently fall on the "delete the test" side of the argument, as the test is bound to create problems like this while at the same time, it doesn't really test the real scenario.

If I run  test on Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.dll directly as below, it succeeds. 

.\packages\xunit.runner.console.2.1.0\tools\xunit.console.exe .\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.dll

 Finished:    Org.Apache.REEF.Tests
=== TEST EXECUTION SUMMARY ===
   Org.Apache.REEF.Tests  Total: 36, Errors: 0, Failed: 0, Skipped: 7, Time: 315.338s
C:\reef\ReefApache\reef2\lang\cs [REEF-325]> .\packages\xunit.runner.console.2.1.0\tools\xunit.console.exe .\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.dll  Finished:    Org.Apache.REEF.Tests
=== TEST EXECUTION SUMMARY ===
   Org.Apache.REEF.Tests  Total: 36, Errors: 0, Failed: 0, Skipped: 7, Time: 315.338s

Why you need to change the version in those two config files? Is it because you scanned the source and find there is version inside the files? 

Those two files are used as input of unit testing. It does test the code like alias classes we defined for Evaluator. 

The version info is not used in the testing. We don't need to replace it. If we don't like any file as unit testing input, we can put the content as static string in unit tests as a separate Jira.

Hi, @jwang98052 . 
Could you read #852 first? After changing version, the tests fails.
I made this PR to help that. I thought we had two options: removing the test cases or changing it to new version.
FYI, on my PC with clean clone, old `change_version.py` makes build failures due to that resource files, too. With this PR, I can pass the tests.

I see. It is caused by the Task and Context Configuration which is based on the current version. 
I have created REEF-1221 to remove this dependency.
Great! Then, I'll close this PR now.
@markusweimer Another round of fixes is in
Looks good, I'll test and merge

I can't repro the error on my machine :-( Error code 4 seems to mean just the number of failed tests, not anything related to the nature of the failure. Are you running tests with Visual Studio open in another window? I sometimes get failures on tests being unable to read some log file which I suspect is not released properly by VS test execution, but when I close VS the tests pass again.
Looks good, passes tests, I'll merge

Close all VS makes test pass. 

I will merge it if there is not other comments.
Thank you, @tcNickolas .

Hi, @tcNickolas . 
It looks good to me and passed the test on Windows.
I'll merge this.

Hi, @afchung . 
Could you rebase this PR to the master?

Of course, the Jenkins error is irrelevant to that. :)
@dongjoon-hyun  Rebased. Thanks!
@afchung Uploaded fixes for your comments (and explanations for ones I didn't fix)
Oops, I thought this was going to my fork. Sorry.
I will test
This has conflicts with `master`. @jwang98052, can you please rebase?
@markusweimer I removed the delayed task and added a builder, please take a look.
Will do. I might have a fix for [REEF-1229](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1229) within the hour, in which case that should probably go in first such that tests of this can pass.
@shulmanb can you check whether this fixes it for you?
I filled #866 for the PID store bug.

Jenkins failure looks irrelevant, all Travis CIs pass, I'll merge.
Thank you for hardening our build verification :-)
Thank you for merging, @tcNickolas .
@markusweimer I don't see the problem anymore
